nodes.bodyText:
The notes element can be used as a sub-element within many other elements. I think that's why the description in the DDI documentation is so vague. The parent element here would be the variable, right? If so, could we edit the tooltip to read something like this?:

For clarifying information/annotation regarding the variable.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -818,11 +818,11 @@ advanced.search.datasets.persistentId=Dataset Persistent ID
 advanced.search.datasets.persistentId.tip=The unique persistent identifier for a dataset, which can be a Handle or DOI in Dataverse.
 
 # search 
-search.datasets.literalquestion=Literal Question
-search.datasets.interviewinstructions=Interview Instructions
-search.datasets.postquestion=Post Question
-search.datasets.variableuniverse=Variable Universe
-search.datasets.variableNotes=Variable Notes
+search.datasets.literalquestion=Text of the actual, literal question asked.
+search.datasets.interviewinstructions=Specific instructions to the individual conducting an interview.
+search.datasets.postquestion=Text describing what occurs after the literal question has been asked.
+search.datasets.variableuniverse=The group of persons or other elements that are the object of research and to which any analytic results refer.
+search.datasets.variableNotes=For clarifying information/annotation regarding the parent element.
